newsitem.title: INDIA: Bill Gates says he does not think much about money.
newsitem.headline: Bill Gates says he does not think much about money.

text.p: Bill Gates, one of the world's richest men, said on Tuesday he does not think much about money and would give his riches away, but not yet.

"I am not somebody who takes a lot of time spending money and thinking about money...," Gates, who owns 25 percent of Microsoft Corp, the world's biggest software company, said at a news conference in New Delhi.
Later, asked at a business meeting if it was true that he planned to give his riches away, Gates replied: "That's true," but added, "For quite sometime, that won't be my focus."

Thousands of people swarmed to see Gates talk on his vision of India as a major software producer, but quite a few were apparently in awe of his wealth. Last December, his Microsoft stake was estimated at $23 billion.
Gates said he had a few decades ahead leading Microsoft before giving money away. "I have a lot of time before I think about that," he said.
"I think I have a great job, it is a fun job," Gates said.
"The reason I think my job is the best job in the world is because every day I am learning new things and everyday I am working with very smart people."
